TopicTitle: [Kopernicus] The Kirius System [Not Yet Ready for 2.0 release]

Articles.Content:
Work is in progress on a new version. Stay tuned!

[Dev thread here](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/130051-Kopernicus-The-Kirius-System-Kirius-is-back%21-%28Well-it-will-be-soon-anyway%21%29)

**Edited <time datetime="2015-07-30T14:58:21Z" title="07/30/2015 02:58  PM" data-short="8 yr">July 30, 2015</time> by \_Augustus\_**

Would it be possible for you to add textures for Astronomers Visual Pack?

Otherwise, nice work ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

> 
> Would it be possible for you to add textures for Astronomers Visual Pack?
> Otherwise, nice work ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

AVP is so memory-consuming that running this with that would kill your game if you had any mods.

Also, it doesn't have the same sun effects as BA.

Have you got the binary system orbiting around a barrycenter, or kerbol itself?

Also, do solar panels work near the other stars?

> 
> Have you got the binary system orbiting around a barrycenter, or kerbol itself?
> Also, do solar panels work near the other stars?

It's Kerbol itself.

And no solar panels do not work.

I was looking at Wot's orbit...

How? Why? Is this real life? WOT????

**Edited <time datetime="2015-02-22T18:26:11Z" title="02/22/2015 06:26  PM" data-short="9 yr">February 22, 2015</time> by TheJewelOfJool**

> 
> I was looking at Wot's orbit...
> How? Why? Is this real life?

There are red dwarfs orbiting that close to white dwarfs. The white dwarfs suck up the red dwarfs' gas until they become too unstable and explode.
And then it goes boom.... I fear for the exploration teams of that star.

This is interesting, I like it! Also, since I had a lot of free time and I hadn't made a KopernicusTech planet in a while, I decided to make one for this:

> [Javascript is disabled. View full album](//imgur.com/a/IFW6w)

And if you'd like to try it, here's a download link for it: [DOWNLOAD](https://www./?w66z71uhc8lcmqt)

> 
> This is interesting, I like it! Also, since I had a lot of free time and I hadn't made a KopernicusTech planet in a while, I decided to make one for this:
> [http://imgur.com/a/IFW6w](http://imgur.com/a/IFW6w)
> 
> And if you'd like to try it, here's a download link for it: [DOWNLOAD](https://www./?w66z71uhc8lcmqt)

I'm implementing this in the next update, though I'm decreasing the semi-major axis.

Just helping this awesome mod in any way I can! ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif) What are you decreasing it to, by the way? (Above or below the orbit of Krux?)

> 
> Just helping this awesome mod in any way I can! ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif) What are you decreasing it to, by the way? (Above or below the orbit of Krux?)

Below Krux and Mirax.

Those new planets. They look PERFECT. Good work!

Hi. I've extracted this and the KopernicusTech into the gamedata folder, but get no new planets. Do I have to activate or change something else?

Damn, Krux looks so beautiful as the logo. ![:cool:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cool.gif)
